intro: Phyllostegia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
